titleStmt.title: Charles R. Smith to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1026

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
Confidential.
Cincinnati Decr. 22. 1865
To the Honorable the Governor of Kentucky.
Dear Sir.

I have the honor to enquire if you have official knowledge of one Wilkins Warren, being a Fugitive from Justice from Bath co. Kentucky where he is charged with the crime of Murder, said to have been committed in the Spring of 1865. If such be the case will ^you^ do me the honor of so informing me and in addition thereto, if such be practicable, please furnish me with the name of the victim, and also of some of his friends. The matter was mentioned to me an hour ago, and I do not desire to move in it until I am aware of its breadth
and that the criminal is wanted by your authorities. My information is the effect that said Warren can be found and the location has been furnished me.
Will you do me the favor of an early reply.

Very Respectfully
Your Obedient Servant
Charles R. Smith
Late Deputy Prov. Marshal
1" District of Ohio.
Address, Lock Drawer No 176 Post Office.
